2011-01-13 16:13:10,629 ERROR [btpool0-16166] com.opensymphony.webwork.interceptor.FileUploadInterceptor com.opensymphony.webwork.interceptor.FileUploadInterceptor-intercept - Could not find a Content-Type for upload. Verify that a valid file was submitted.

fields.description:
If the domain in admin doesn't match the domain you're browsing from you can get logged out.

accept a parameter to choose between relative and absolute urls, or
always return relative urls and a single base url that can be combined for the absolute urls.

fields.description:
Once you press the "Summarize" link and get the dialog to summarize and close the review, you can close the dialog by pressing "Escape". If you do this however, the review is in a weird state somewhere between open and closed. If you refresh the page it will open the popup again and ask you to summarize the review.

If a user presses escape to close the summarize dialog, the review should revert to an open state.
fields.summary: Pressing Escape after clicking the Summarize button should 'Cancel' the closing of the review

fields.description:
To prevent likely irrelevant results appearing at the top of the search results, boost by lastModified date.

This requires adding the lastModified date for a logical path to the index.

fields.description: The current createReview REST API takes both a reviewData and a detailedReviewData. The underlying code implementation only uses one of these and also does not allow for the detailedReviewData to be mixed with the changeset element.
fields.summary: REST API CreateReview issues

fields.description:
If a user decides to disable sub-task creation within Crucible code reviews, they cannot as JIRA Settings page for the application link ignores the blanked out values and puts back the previous values.

Steps to recreate:

1. Setup JIRA Settings sub-task with numbers
2. Click Done
3. Edit JIRA Settings, blank out sub-task fields
4. Click Done
5. Edit JIRA Settings. sub-task fields still have previous numbers.

The only way to get round this is to delete and recreate the Application Link
fields.summary: Removing values for sub-task JIRA integration is ignored when you click done

fields.description:
It would be really handy to have a link to the file that the Author/Moderator is currently viewing. There currently is a box in the lower right hand corner that shows how many reviewers there are and a couple of other options. It'd be great to have something such as "File opened by Moderator: /some/path/blah.java". Including a link to the file would make it even better!

Justification: Our company (PAETEC) currently does larger reviews in a group often via phone or video conference. There are inevitably times where some interruptions will pull someone away and we'll either need to interrupt the whole review or IM someone else to ask what file we're reviewing.
fields.summary: Provide "Current File" information when viewing a Crucible Code Review

fields.description:

<web-resource key="javascript-enhancer" name="Some javascript">

		<context>atl.general</context>
	</web-resource>
{code}

This might affect Fisheye, too.
fields.summary: atl.general decorator is not applied in Crucible

fields.description:
Classification: Factually incorrect
Ranking: Major
Requires Re-Review: Yes

Created by Nick Pellow from Geoff Crain's Crucible defect on AgeColourer.java lines 160-163 https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-4687#c41164 :

this protects against the NPE but it is wrong

its going to mark all 'from' lines as high. that is, it will be saying that the revision that every line of a file was added is the revision that it was deleted.

the problem is not in AgeColourer, its in diffRenderer.tag - we are passing a null colourer into the renderer
fields.summary: this protects against the NPE but it is wrong  its going to mark all 'from' lines as high. that is, it will be saying that the revision that every line of a file was added is the revision that it was deleted.  the problem is not in AgeColourer, its in ...

fields.description:
RSS feed items (git, in our case) come through with the entire commit message as the item's subject.  This has some issues because:

* It's a git standard to summarize with the first line of the commit message.
* Some of our commit messages are long -- a page or more.
* Most commit messages have wiki formatting which renders single-line display as very unhelpful.
* The full commit message is duplicated in the item content, with proper wiki formatting and links.
fields.summary: Changeset RSS Feeds should not use entire commit message as subject
[ActivityStream] Fix RSS feeds

fields.description:
Open reviews are moved from the author's "Outbox / Out for Review" to the moderator's "Inbox / To Summarize" when all the reviewers have marked the review as "Completed"

This presents a problem because reviewers may have entered comments and defects that the author has not worked or viewed.  Reviewers can still see the review in the Outbox but the author does not see the review.

The author's Outbox needs to include an "Outbox / To Moderator" so they know their review is still active in the system waiting for the Moderator to close the review.  This would also permit the author to check their open review to see if they have comments and defects to work.

Another option would be to leave the review in the author's "Outbox / Out for Review" when it is also in the moderator's "Inbox / To Summarize" until the Moderator closes the review.

To replicate the problem:
Open a review with a Moderator and one or more reviewers.  
Have each reviewer mark the review as completed.
As the moderator - check the Inbox / To Summarize to see the review
As the author - the review is not visible in their Outbox - their only access is my editing the URL
fields.summary: Author does not have visibility of a peer review when it has moved to the Moderator's To Summarize Inbox

fields.description:
If you add an anchored pre commit patch that contains a diff to a file that does not exist in the repository, all reviewers will receive the following error when they attempt to view the changes:

"
Error
A javax.el.ELException was encountered

com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.DbException: Unable to get binary rev for a directory :
Unable to get binary rev for a directory :
You are running release CR2.4.3 FE2.4.3 (20101126023954 2010-11-26), please report your release number when reporting bugs.

Got a suggestion or an issue?
Discuss it in our forums or visit our support website for other options.
"

There should be a clear error describing the problem rather than the java exception.
fields.summary: Pre Commit Patch Containing Non-existant File causes Java Exception

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Crucible's edit review details screen.

Affected versions are Crucible 2.2.0 to 2.3.7 inclusive.

XSS vulnerabilities potentially allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a FishEye/Crucible page. You can read more about XSS attacks at various places on the web, including these:

    * cgisecurity.com: http://www.cgisecurity.com/articles/xss-faq.shtml
    * The Web Application Security Consortium: http://projects.webappsec.org/Cross-Site+Scripting

This issue is reported in our security advisory on these pages:

    * http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/fwapDQ
    * http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/gQapDQ
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in Edit Review Details

i assume its because we are using the history of the "to" revision to colour the blame of the "from" revision. we do this so that the colours are consistent in the diff. it should just use the from revision colourer if the to revision one doesnt exist.

fields.description:
Premisses:
JIRA 4.2 and FishEye 2.4.3 are correctly configured and integrated with each other.
JIRA and FishEye have the same user created.

* Situation 1: Total anonymous access
1- No admin password was inserted (by accessing http://host:port/admin for the first time)
2- No user logged in, not even administrators
If anonymous access is allowed in FishEye and the user goes to People --> select any user --> select "Issues" in the Activity section, he's able to see that user's issue activities in JIRA (e.g., issues he created, edited, etc). The same happens in the Dashboard.
Dashboard accessed anonymously:
!Dashboard_Anonymous.JPG!
User selected on People tab and accessed anonymously:
!People_Anonymous.JPG!

* Situation 2: admin password inserted - by accessing http://host:port/admin for the first time
After inserting the admin password, back to the Dashboard, no issues listed:
!Dashboard_Admin.JPG!
After inserting the admin password, back to People --> select user, no issues listed:
!People_Admin.JPG!

(Now, restart FishEye to inactivate the admin password inserted on *Situation 2*)

* Situation 3: user (with or without administrator privileges) logged in
After logging in, the dashboard does not display issues created by the user, even if "Show My Activity" checkbox is selected:
!Dashboard_Login.JPG!
After logging in, back to People --> select any user, no issues listed:
!People_Login.JPG!

Please let me know if you need further explanation.

Best regards,
Felipe Kraemer
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: After login, user is no longer able to see issue activities in JIRA

fields.description:
Due to using a PhraseQuery when searching, and the fact we index each character for every single file name, a long query string will take much longer to search than a shorter one. 

e.g. 9000ms (83 results) https://atlaseye-qa.atlassian.com/atlaseye/qsearch?q=ConfluenceActionSupport.properties&t=fd&repository=

c.f. 800ms (29055 results) https://atlaseye-qa.atlassian.com/atlaseye/qsearch?q=Action&t=fd&repository=


Investigate if it would be ok to only do sub-word substring matching using n-grams.
http://lucene.apache.org/java/3_0_0/api/all/org/apache/lucene/analysis/ngram/EdgeNGramTokenizer.html

The following file would be analyzed like so:
AbstractContentFactory: 

Abstract: a, ab, abs, abst...
Content: c, co, con, cont...
Factory: f, fa, fac, fact...
AbstractContentFactory: a, ab, abs, abst... abstractc, abstractco, .... abstractcontentfactory


This would mean the following queries would match this document:

ACF, AbConFacto, *Factory, abstract, abs, abstractcontent, fac, factory, AbsFac

And these would not match the document:

acf, tent, entFac, entFac*, *entFac, confact, FacAbs, your mum
fields.summary: The longer the query, the slower the search.

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the FishEye/Crucible changeset page heading.

Affected versions are FishEye/Crucible 2.3.2 to 2.4.0 inclusive.

XSS vulnerabilities potentially allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a FishEye/Crucible page. You can read more about XSS attacks at various places on the web, including these:

    * cgisecurity.com: http://www.cgisecurity.com/articles/xss-faq.shtml
    * The Web Application Security Consortium: http://projects.webappsec.org/Cross-Site+Scripting

This issue is reported in our security advisory on these pages:

    * http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/fwapDQ
    * http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/gQapDQ
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in FishEye/Crucible Changeset Page Heading

See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Migrating+to+an+External+Database?focusedCommentId=229180372#comment-229180372

The avatar icon is to small to be of use in the columns of review listings. please replace with name or make configurable. See attachment.

Reference: CRC-2186
fields.summary: Avatar icon in review summary columns are to small

fields.description: Since PhraseQuery performs poorly on common terms, making each letter a term is not a good idea. We should check out making terms out of camelcase boundaries and see how that goes. Consequences include losing substring matches ("set" won't match "BaseTest") and some index size increases. This is imperative if we want to get decent speed out of large FE instances
fields.summary: Investigate camelcase analyzer for new search

fields.description: The old quicksearch would automagically limit its search to the repository you were in. We should do the same.
fields.summary: Add repository context sensitive search

fields.description:
When trying to make an application link it generates an IllegalArgumentException when checking the url. I traced it to the app calling this url https://myhost.dk/fecru/rest/applinks/1.0/applicationlinkForm/url/https://myhost.dk/jira/.json
The nginx proxy cleans up that url to the equivalent url https://myhost.dk/fecru/rest/applinks/1.0/applicationlinkForm/url/https:/myhost.dk/jira/.json which causes the exception.

When skipping the proxy it works fine.
fields.summary: Can't create application link when behind proxy

fields.description:
We have been using Crucible so far for our review purposes.
Suddenly we are facing errors on using REST API for getting and posting data.

e.g. 
Posting {"addChangeset": {"changesets": {"changesetData": [{"id": 452193}]}, "repository": "BASE"}}
gives
{u'body': u'{"code":"JsonMapping","message":"Unrecognized field \\"addChangeset\\"

Similary all REST calls like GET /rest-service/projects-v1 have different format.

Can you please point us to the latest REST API guide? I find that the existing REST guide is outdated

=Arun
fields.summary: REST API not working with Crucible 2.4.x

fields.description: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-4649/#c40930
fields.summary: new activity stream will have the year next to it when you are in january

fields.description:
Accordingly to this [page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Using+Keyboard+Shortcuts+in+Crucible], to select the source line content in review, we can hold down 'alt' key, then click and drag to select source line contents in review but this does not work.

A workaround to this issue is to click on the 'Ctrl+Alt' key, then select your code in review there.
fields.summary: Not able to select source line contents in review

fields.description:
* comments dont have the correct read status
* comment times are in server time
* indenting is screwed
* emails are coming from the server rather than from the user
* comment ids are formatted as numbers (with a ',')
* revisions added is missing newline chars
* revisions added count variable is not evaled
* "and Blah" have finished reviewing
* different time limits for different roles
fields.summary: batch notification fixes

fields.description:
Minor usability issues:

1. I would like to be able to link several CRs from Jira to review in "Edit details" window, now I can link only one issue.I think it is useful  when you have several change requests on particular functionality/module/scope and fix covers all of them.

2. I would like to be able to choose branches from version control system in "Edit details" window to point a reviewer where my fix is situated.
Now I can use for that purposes some text fields, however, it is much easy not to switch in any external tool and copy-paste to from it into Crucible,but just select from some recently created branches and so on.

3. I'd like to remove revisions/patch files not via "Add" button in toolbar. It is really confusing me every time when I do it.
fields.summary: Some usability improvements

fields.description: Studio streams uses Atom to aggregate activity from FishEye. We need to ensure that our changes are not going to break studio's rendering or content that is shown.
fields.summary: [ActivityStream] Ensure that we are still compatible with Studio streams
Activity Stream Blitz
[ActivityStream] Steam ellipsis and path abbreviation
[ActivityStream] Styling for JIRA activity items
[ActivityStream] Styling for review completion and participant change items
[ActivityStream] Styling for review comment items
[ActivityStream] Styling for review state change items
[ActivityStream] Styling for changeset items

fields.description: When you add a new repository in the admin using IE8, the 'add' button in the final page of the wizard can be clicked, but nothing happens. This is only a problem with IE8.
fields.summary: Admin: cannot add new repo with IE8. 'Add' button has no effect
